hero.partBoldEnd: and explore a new world of calm, beauty, and real adventure

aboutBedouin.description: *We are the Bedouins of Farafra Oasis, the people and guardians of the White Desert.* We offer an experience that comes straight from the heart of the place itself. *For us, camping is a complete way of life, not just accommodation* — filled with simplicity, comfort, *and real adventure* in a nature we truly love and protect because it’s part of who we are.
aboutBedouin.quote: *Our experience in the White Desert spans more than 26 years* — we know its routes, seasons, and secrets by heart. Every trip we organize is built on real knowledge and authentic experience. *We’ve run the same programs thousands of times* with adventurers from different countries around the world.

firstTime.question: Is the trip suitable for me even if it's my first time in the desert?
firstTime.answer: Yes. The trip is designed for beginners going to the desert for the first time or for adventurers who have tried before. The program is gradual and equipped to let you enjoy while feeling secure, without prior experience.

comfortable.question: Are the sleeping arrangements and equipment really comfortable?
comfortable.answer: Yes. We use the best types of tents, mattresses, sleeping bags, and blankets suitable for the desert cold, keeping you warm and comfortable in the middle of the desert. With the Farafra Oasis Bedouin guarantee for immediate solutions if you need anything, the goal is for you to have the best White Desert experience while being comfortable.

bathroom.question: Is there a bathroom? Or will it be difficult?
bathroom.answer: At the Farafra camp, there's a bathroom and electricity. And in camping, there are appropriate facilities for the desert that maintain your comfort and respect for the place, not a random experience or embarrassment.

food.question: What about the food?
food.answer: Food is an essential part of the experience, not an addition. 7 complete meals, fresh and Organic food, enough and on time, with Zarda tea and hot drinks all day.

hiddenCosts.question: Are there any other costs besides what's written?
hiddenCosts.answer: No. Everything is included in the price: transportation, safari, camping, hotel, food, activities, and reserve fees. All included, no hidden extra costs. The only thing you'll account for is personal expenses only or gifts.

day1.title: Day One – Friday
activities: 05:30 AM: Visit El-Gara Cave (the strangest cave in Egypt)
09:00 AM: Arrival at Uzersaif Camp in Farafra Oasis + Egyptian breakfast (camp equipped with bathroom and electricity)

10:00 AM: Start moving *with 4x4 safari vehicles and visiting:*
◦ Valley of Obstacles
◦ Moon Cave
◦ Sandboarding
◦ Hanes Valley
◦ 2:00 PM: Ain Khadra (light lunch)
◦ Ice House – Moon Surface
◦ Camps Valley
◦ Famous formations: Mushroom – Chicken – Rabbit – Horse – Camel – Sphinx
5:00 PM: At sunset: Setting up camp – receiving tents and sleeping equipment
9:00 PM: BBQ dinner with Bedouin marinade + stargazing night with fire and Zarda tea

day2.title: Day Two – Saturday
activities: Sunrise + Bedouin breakfast in the heart of the desert
8:00 AM: Breaking camp and returning to Farafra Oasis
10:30 AM: Check into Bedouin hotel – 3 hours rest
2:00 PM: Head to UzerSaif Camp (light lunch)

*Places to visit today:* 
◦ Farafra Palace and Amina House 
◦ Oasis gardens and Roman springs 
◦ Badr Abdel Moghny Museum (world heritage)
9:00 PM: Bedouin Mizmar party + Mandi dinner

day3.title: Day Three – Sunday
activities: 08:00 AM: Leave rooms + breakfast at UzerSaif Camp
11:45 AM: Tea session by the Roman springs
3:00 PM: Stop to buy oasis products

food.title: Food
items: Fresh organic & healthy food, and you can ask for more

Sleeping bag that handles extreme cold + extra blanket

safety.title: Safety

instructions.title: *Instructions*
items: Pack light - bring only *essentials and personal items*
Morning is *warm*, afternoon is *pleasant*, night gets *cold*
*Comfortable clothes* for movement and sand, don't forget your *sunglasses and cap*
Shoes are *the most important thing* - sandals, crocs, or flip-flops work
Don't forget a *flashlight* or use your phone flash & *power bank*
If you love *coffee*, bring your favorite beans
